You need to know the maps and where vaults and pallets spawn as killer or as survivor, some maps are absolutely bad designed and horrible to play on both sides

the community often is toxic no matter if you play killer or survivor.

You need OP builds, you get matched with people that have those op builds but also 100 times more playtime as you do for some reason.

Highly recommend the game.
Good with a mate or two, great with 4 or 5

Most matches are very fun and the game offers the ability for players mix and match perks all they want.
Fun to play either as Killer or Survivor.
But if your playing by yourself, you should play Killer

Game fun, go buy :jarate:
Let it take over your life.

Every time I play killer it feels like I'm the one being chased and being transformed into a blind bat because of their flashlights. It gathers up every last bit of my soul and feeds it to the entity. The entity then uses my own soul to gain power so it can shove a large, black spider leg right up my ass. Yet I still always come back for more for some unknown reason... I guess I always come back to hear Steve and Bill scream on sacrificial hooks? I chuckle every time that happens :) Maybe there's something wrong with me...
Best game to destroy your new monitor!

I wouldn't recommend it to you unless you have a group of friends to play with. Playing solo survivor though is fun at times , can be mentally draining most of the time because of the lack of communication which is vital to coordinate and even escape since you're mostly hopeless on your own.

If you're thinking about buying this game to be a killer, then you may wanna run away as fast as you can from this game.
unless you're a Veteran then you should know the skill ceiling have risen so high it's not even a joke to say you need hundreds of hours before you can perform at an average level.
Matchmaking is an absolute nightmare, and some of the survivors add ons and perks are broken
The last addition of healing Boons is one good example
if the team is communicating then you can kiss your sanity goodbye

I have about 15 hours here and 30 on PlayStation, about 40 to 45 hours total.
There were occasionally fun matches, but it's not worth it overall
Most Veteran players have played the game in it's early stages and didn't have to suffer through the current existing complexity all at once. So their perspective is biased and doesn't reflect the egregious unbalances and issues this game has that a new or a returning player would be concerned about.

The fact of the matter is most players who you will be playing against now are mostly old players who will make sure to let you know that having an opinion after 30 or 40 or even 100 hours doesn't count. They take the game and their pride too seriously, unforgiving and extremely toxic.

I would suggest you save your money for the other game you've been considering.
the game is pretty fun it's just the community . some people will do everything in their power just to ruin your fun . it still needs some major things added but it's good overall

With the time I have in this game not being all that impressive when you look at other players I have some things to say about this game. 
All in all the game is fun when you can just detach from the oppressive community that it has. When you are just playing to have fun you will have fun. Yes there is the odd shit mechanic which gives you a real good knee slapper "Oh I guess I got outplayed" moment like forgetting someone has dead hard and swinging just for them to keep running you for 20 more seconds, but that doesn't mean this game is bad. If you want to play killer, just know that when you start getting better, so will the people you play against, meaning your games will be harder... like any other game. Playing survivor and learning how to actually pull off a good chase giving your team time to (hopefully) do gens is also another dopamine rush people forget when starting to play more. 
If you are new, buy it for sure, it's fun. If you are a vet, stop complaining and just have some fun!
its very scary and fun to play with friends

The devs don't actually want to balance the game. They want money. I have never seen an online game receive so little balance support and have the patches be so inable to actually deal with any problem that exists in the game. There is no reason to pick up this game. Let it die and have competitors pick up the people that want an asymmetrical PvP experience.
this game is not for the weak
always the same thing its get kind of boring after one hours they should add more thing to the game

It all started when I first got Dead by Daylight, I remember it so vividly. I looked through the list of killers like a kid in a toy shop, reading about their powers and thinking of how I would use them as I waited for a new match. When I finished that I began looking at their expertly crafted models, inspecting every polygon on every character. As I made my way through I saw it, the Plagues half nipple, slipping out of her beautiful robes. Of course I had seen hags nipslip before, but she was simply a broken half eaten corpse. Plague on the other hand was a beauty, 8 feet tall, and filled out thighs that hung out from her robes, a mommy in all regards. After seeing that nipple of course, I instantly came. As I sat there exhausted looking at the end of match screen I realized I had came for the entire duration of a match and had been afk. I clicked the upgrade button, ignoring the pissy survivors calling me out for being afk. I put my pants on and began looking at Plagues beautiful nipple. Seeing the cum on my keyboard made me angry, that was wasted cum that should've been pumped into tight half rotted Plague pussy. That brings me to today, I had to throw out my RGB mechanical keyboard because my cum got between the keys and rotted, and I don't have the money to replace it because I spent all my money on Plague body pillows and fake vomit to drink as I imagine it's hers. My parents found my jar I use to clean up my cum and vomit after I'm done worshipping the Plague pussy, praying to whatever deity may exist that Plague might become real. The jar was a congealed moldy mess, resembling cheese more than any of the liquids that went in. I begged Mom not to kick me out but she did. My Plague mommy would have never kicked me out. Plague would have shown me kindness, then put my face between her tits and vomited in my mouth. When I die I want to die from drowning in Plague vomit. People may call me a detriment to society, but I would be a hard working man if I just got some fat vomit covered Plague pussy.
Addicting game, toxic people, but love to live a bad life so highly recommend.

uh yeah i guess so, it's pretty fun if you like dying, getting camped, missing skill-checks, and being Nea.

A game thats fun for a little while, especially with friends. Some may find it more inducing to keep playing but personally its only fun when you have a whole group after about 10 hours.

It doesn't feel as rewarding to keep playing just to have teammates fail as survivor or to play against players that haven't stopped playing since launch as killer. Matchmaking is broken in my experience, leveling feels like a chore just to get one talent so you can switch characters that won't ever have that talent show up. 

Now thats not to say this game isn't fun or that it doesn't have its moments. Gameplay is interactive and fun, but like battleroyals I can't really reccomend one with a pricetag on it.
Esta bueno porque es original y divertido lo malo es el desbalance que hay y lo emperejamientos
